articles.headline: Winner but Not Chancellor, Yet: The Race to Replace Merkel
articles.snippet: Olaf Scholz, of the center-left Social Democrats, narrowly won the night. But now the hard part begins — building a durable governing coalition.
articles.abstract: Olaf Scholz, of the center-left Social Democrats, narrowly won the night. But now the hard part begins — building a durable governing coalition.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — For a moment it felt like he was already chancellor. As Olaf Scholz stood on the stage surrounded by euphoric followers chanting his name and celebrating him as if he were the next leader of Germany, he was the clear winner of the night.

articles.headline: Republicans Block Government Funding, Refusing to Lift Debt Limit
articles.snippet: Senate Republicans opposed legislation to avert a government shutdown and prevent a debt default at a critical moment for Democrats’ domestic agenda.
articles.abstract: Senate Republicans opposed legislation to avert a government shutdown and prevent a debt default at a critical moment for Democrats’ domestic agenda.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow our live news coverage on the government shutdown and infrastructure bill.

articles.headline: Ford Will Build 4 Factories in a Big Electric Vehicle Push
articles.snippet: The automaker and a supplier will spend $11.4 billion on three battery factories and a truck plant, creating 11,000 jobs.
articles.abstract: The automaker and a supplier will spend $11.4 billion on three battery factories and a truck plant, creating 11,000 jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ford Motor significantly increased its commitment to electric cars and trucks on Monday by announcing that it would spend billions of dollars to build three battery factories and an electric truck plant in the United States, creating 11,000 jobs over the next four years.

articles.headline: How Covid Misinformation Created a Run on Animal Medicine
articles.snippet: Veterinarians, ranchers and farmers say they are struggling with the effects of the surging demand for ivermectin, a deworming drug.
articles.abstract: Veterinarians, ranchers and farmers say they are struggling with the effects of the surging demand for ivermectin, a deworming drug.
articles.lead_paragraph: Emerson Animal Hospital was down to its last 10 milliliters of ivermectin.

articles.headline: Yellen Warns of ‘Catastrophic’ Consequences From Debt Limit Breach
articles.snippet: The Treasury secretary, testifying alongside Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, implored Congress to raise or suspend the nation’s borrowing cap before an Oct. 18 deadline.
articles.abstract: The Treasury secretary, testifying alongside Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, implored Congress to raise or suspend the nation’s borrowing cap before an Oct. 18 deadline.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen warned lawmakers on Tuesday of “catastrophic” consequences if Congress failed to raise or suspend the statutory debt limit in less than three weeks, saying inaction could lead to a self-inflicted economic recession and a financial crisis.
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport, Emily Cochrane and Jeanna Smialek

articles.headline: For Flagging Amazon Games Unit, New World ‘Has to Be Our Breakthrough’
articles.snippet: The tech giant has struggled to produce popular games, but a much-delayed title released this week could be the first step in a turnaround.
articles.abstract: The tech giant has struggled to produce popular games, but a much-delayed title released this week could be the first step in a turnaround.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amazon has been successful in nearly every industry it has entered, from books and grocery shopping to cloud computing and movie streaming. So it has been puzzling to many that success in the lucrative video game business has eluded the tech giant.

articles.headline: Stocks tumble in worst day since May, as tech shares slide and bond yields climb.
articles.snippet: Investors, weighing the prospect of the Federal Reserve preparing to reduce its purchases of government debt, sold off bonds, pushing the 10-year’s yield to its highest level since June.
articles.abstract: Investors, weighing the prospect of the Federal Reserve preparing to reduce its purchases of government debt, sold off bonds, pushing the 10-year’s yield to its highest level since June.
articles.lead_paragraph: The prospect of the Federal Reserve not reaching as deep into its bottomless pockets is starting to hit home for investors.

articles.headline: China and Evergrande Ascended Together. Now One Is About to Fall.
articles.snippet: The property giant’s success mirrored the country’s transformation from an agrarian economy to one that embraced capitalism. Its struggles offer a glimpse of a new financial future.
articles.abstract: The property giant’s success mirrored the country’s transformation from an agrarian economy to one that embraced capitalism. Its struggles offer a glimpse of a new financial future.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Xu Jiayin was China’s richest man, a symbol of the country’s economic rise who helped transform poverty-stricken villages into urbanized metropolises for the fledgling middle class. As his company, China Evergrande Group, became one of the country’s largest property developers, he amassed the trappings of the elite, with trips to Paris to taste rare French wines, a million-dollar yacht, private jets and access to some of the most powerful people in Beijing.
articles.byline: By Alexandra Stevenson, Michael Forsythe and Cao Li
